title: 1955–56 Hapoel Hadera F.C. season
text:
The 1955–56 <a href="Hapoel%20Hadera%20F.C.">Hapoel Hadera</a> season was the club's 23rd season since its establishment, in 1934, and 8th since the establishment of the <a href="Israel">State of Israel</a>.
At the start of the season, the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Alef">league</a> which started during the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20in%20Israeli%20football">previous season</a> was completed, with the club finishing 13th (out of 14), which meant the club relegated to the <a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Liga%20Alef">second division</a>, which was renamed <a href="Liga%20Alef">Liga Alef</a>, and played in this division during the remainder of the season, finishing 7th (out of 12), remaining in the <a href="1956%E2%80%9357%20Liga%20Alef">second division</a> ahead of the <a href="1956%E2%80%9357%20in%20Israeli%20football">next season</a>.
During the season, the club also completed in the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Israel%20State%20Cup">State Cup</a> competition, which started during the previous season. The club was knocked out in the quarter-finals by <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a>, the eventual winners of the competition.
Match Results.
Legend.
 
<a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Alef">1954–55 Liga Alef</a>.
The league began on 6 February 1955, and by the time the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20in%20Israeli%20football">previous season</a> ended, only 20 rounds of matches were completed, with the final 6 rounds being played during September and October 1955.
Matches.
 
<a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Liga%20Alef">1955–56 Liga Alef</a>.
